cab.content: (This Document is the Property ofHis Britannic Majesty's Government.)Military Secret.1216 From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India, 18th December 1919. (Repeated to Constantinople, Baghdad, Kashgar under No. 4598/3.) (Received 22nd.) 16861. Malleson telegraphed 15th December, repeating Tehran :- " Following information has been given by a Polish engineer who left Tashkenton 23rd November and Askabad on 11th December. Turkish Mission which arrivedat Tashkent from Moscow at the beginning of November is about 1,000 strong, it is charged with carrying out intensive revolutionary propaganda in all neighbouring countries and has experts for this work in the Caucasus, Persia, Afghanistan, Indiaand China. About 1,000 Red troops arrived at Tashkent from Central on 11thNovember. They are well organised and disciplined and have many ex-regular officers. They are the advance guard of 30,000 moving from Samarkand, chiefly byroad, on account of railway difficulties. The Bolsheviks intend to bring 150,000 mento Turkestan when railway conditions improve. This informant confirms all otherrecent information that Bolshevik designs have got to be seriously reckoned with andthat the influx of new blood from the centre has enormously stimulated thingsthroughout Turkestan."
